results.question: What caused the increase in capital expenditures related to wireless?
gold_answer: result of investments made to upgrade our wireless network to continue delivering reliable performance for our customers.
results.csv_string_response: "Wireless is a technology that is essential to our customers. These investments reflect our commitment to continue to improve our network to deliver reliable performance for our customers. We are well positioned for the commercial launch of 5G in early 2020. Our network upgrade and related investments in 4.5G and 5G-ready technology are a part of our Connected Home strategy, which aims to deliver a more connected home experience. We are also working to ensure we have adequate capacity to meet the demand for 5G in Canada and the U.S. We have several ongoing initiatives to address the challenges of data traffic, including the introduction of a 5G New Radio (5G NR) standard in 2020 and the commercial launch of 5G in select markets in early 2020. We will continue to invest in our network to meet our customer demands in 2020, and we will continue to focus on driving adoption of 5G and IoT technology."

results.question: What is the definition of deferred revenues?
gold_answer: Performance obligations for which payments have been received by the customer prior to revenue recognition.
results.markdown_table_response: Deferred revenues are all payments or commitments made by a customer for services that are expected to be delivered at a later date. Deferred revenues are generally recognized in the period in which the performance obligation is incurred. A customer has the right to defer the performance obligation until a later date. A deferred performance obligation may be recorded in a financial statement at any time if the customer makes a payment or a commitment for the performance obligation. Deferred revenues are also commonly referred to as deferred revenues.

The Company will then recognize as revenue the amount of the transaction price that is allocated to the respective performance obligation when, or as, the performance obligation is satisfied. When determining the transaction price of the contract, an adjustment is made if payment from a customer occurs either significantly before or significantly after performance, resulting in a significant financing component.
The Company’s existing license and collaboration agreements may contain a single performance obligation or may contain multiple performance obligations. Those which contain multiple performance obligations will require an allocation of the transaction price based on the estimated relative standalone selling prices of the promised services underlying each performance obligation.
The Company’s existing license and collaboration agreements contain customer options for the license of additional products and territories. We determined the option’s standalone selling prices based on the option product’s potential market size in the option territory as compared to the currently licensed product and U.S. territory. Cubic Transportation Systems
Sales: CTS sales increased 27% to $849.8 million in 2019 compared to $670.7 million in 2018, including the impact of the adoption of ASC 606. The increase in sales was primarily driven by growth in both organic and inorganic business in North America. Sales in 2019 were higher in the U.S. primarily due to system development on contracts in New York, Boston, and the San Francisco Bay Area. Businesses acquired by CTS during fiscal year 2019, whose operations are all located in the U.S., had sales of $74.4 million in fiscal year 2019. Sales increased slightly in Australia between fiscal years 2018 and 2019 as increased system development work on a contract in Brisbane was partially offset by the negative impact of foreign currency exchange rates as well as a decrease in service sales. Sales were lower in the UK primarily due to a decrease in system development work in London and the negative impact of currency exchange rates. The average exchange rates between the prevailing currencies in our foreign operations and the U.S. dollar resulted in a decrease in CTS sales of $22.2 million for 2019 compared to 2018, primarily due to the strengthening of the U.S. dollar against the British pound and Australian dollar.
